verses.roman:
tīrthānāṁ srotasāṁ gaṅgā
samudraḥ sarasām aham
āyudhānāṁ dhanur ahaṁ
tripura-ghno dhanuṣmatām

synonyms: tirthānām—among holy places; srotasām—among flowing things; gaṅgā—the sacred Ganges; samudraḥ—the ocean; sarasām—among steady bodies of water; aham—I am; āyudhānām—among weapons; dhanuḥ—the bow; aham—I am; tri-pura-ghnaḥ—Lord Śiva; dhanuḥ-matām—among those who wield the bow.
translation: Among sacred and flowing things I am the holy Ganges, and among steady bodies of water I am the ocean. Among weapons I am the bow, and of the wielders of weapons I am Lord Śiva.

purport.content: Lord Śiva used his bow to completely cover with arrows the three demoniac cities built by Maya Dānava.
